definitions.definition: A change in nature, form, or quality.
The transference of a bodily function or disease to another part of the body , specifically the development of a secondary area of disease remote from the original site, as with some cancers .
The spread of something harmful to another location, like the metastasis of a cancer.
Denying adversaries' arguments and turning the arguments back on them.

main_definition: A change in nature, form, or quality.
secondary_definitions: ( medicine ) The transference of a bodily function or disease to another part of the body , specifically the development of a secondary area of disease remote from the original site, as with some cancers .
( figurative ) The spread of something harmful to another location, like the metastasis of a cancer.
( rhetoric ) Denying adversaries' arguments and turning the arguments back on them.
